newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real drops 0.05 pct in speculative trade.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real drops 0.05 pct in speculative trade.

text.p: Brazil's real fell 0.05 percent to close at 1.0196 to the dollar in the commercial foregin exchange market, with players speculating about a possible new drop in the real-dollar mini-band, dealers said.
The current mini-band of 1.019 to 1.024 was set Tuesday by the Central Bank.
Because the Central Bank refrained from lowering the mini-band today, the market is betting for a drop on Monday, dealers said.
The market also reacted today to speculation over new dollar outflows, causing the real to fall to 1.0200 at midday.
In the afternoon, the real recovered some ground due to dollar inflows and the absence of interventions from the Central Bank, dealers said.
Preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed a Friday surplus of $30 million.
In the interbank foreign exchange floating rate market, the real closed at 1.0248 to the dollar, down 0.07 percent.
In the illegal parallel market, the real ended flat at 1.037 per greenback.
